chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth R. Brewer Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth R. Brewer in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   State moves to amend Ct #1 to Misd possession.  Court approves.  DE pleads No Contest to amended Ct #1.  Found Guilty.    DE pleads No Contest to Ct #3.  Found Guilty.
Ct #2 is dismissed but read in.

Ct #1:  6 months county jail IMPOSED BUT STAYED.  DEF is placed on 2 years probation, conditions of probation:  Pay fine/costs $673.50-  DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $200 surcharge which is included in those costs.   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Absolute Sobriety.  Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
Ct #3:  1 year county jail IMPOSED BUT STAYED.  DEF is placed on 2 years probation, conditions of probation: 90 days county jail, with Huber, DEF has credit for 2 days served.  Report to jail no later than November 4, 2016 3:00 pm.  Pay fine/costs $642.00 DEF MUST PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE and pay applicable $200 surcharge which is included in those costs.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Absolute Sobriety.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
Conditional Jail time and probation may be served in Barron County if approved and at no additional cost to Sawyer County.  DEF must report to Sawyer County probation office today.  
If sentences are later imposed and served, they are to run concurrently.
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Kenneth R. Brewer in court, appearing by phone after being called by the court, with attorney Martin Jarvis in person.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Jarvis states the DE has approved an agreement presented by the DA.  Jury trial can be removed from the calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Final pre-trial on July 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on July 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
